quest.name: Guardian of Eorzea
journal: Minfilia has some correspondence she wishes to share with you.

Minfilia informs you that a letter has arrived expressing gratitude for the Scions' efforts in quelling the primal threat. Though the realm is not yet free of strife, the Antecedent stresses that your deeds inspire countless Eorzeans to continue along the difficult road to peace. Conscious that you cannot be expected to spend your every waking moment attending to realm-shaking matters, however, she encourages you to stay awhile in Revenant's Toll. Just when it seems as if you have been granted leave to rest, Minfilia asks that you spare a moment to indulge the attention of the Doman children. Speak with Yozan within the Rising Stones.

Elated to see you returned to Revenant's Toll, Yozan and his fellow “Doman adventurers” beg you to give them a special training session. Hoary Boulder, the Roegadyn who has taken charge of the children's daily instruction, instead proposes a sparring match between you and himself. Head to the east of Revenant's Toll and speak with Hoary Boulder to signify your readiness to begin the demonstration of martial skill.

You have bested Hoary Boulder in the sparring match. The gathered onlookers cheer your victory, and praise your hard-won strength. Following the bout, Alphinaud approaches you and asks that you meet with him to discuss the future of Eorzea. Head to the Rising Stones and speak with the young Elezen.
You return to the Rising Stones, and Alphinaud outlines his proposal to form a new organization. Join the determined Scion as he endeavors to fulfill his role as a guardian of Eorzea.
objectives: Meet Hoary Boulder to the east of Revenant's Toll.
Speak with Alphinaud in the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To accept this quest, you must abandon the current main scenario quest. Open the corresponding entry in the journal or duty list and select “Abandon.”

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Now the matter of Ramuh has, for the present, been put to rest, there is something I would show you, Forename.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It is a letter of thanks, signed by the leaders of the Eorzean Alliance, acknowledging the Scions' tireless service to the realm.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It mentions, in particular, the names of all of the defeated primals─Ifrit, Titan, Garuda, Good King Moggle Mog XII, Leviathan, and now Ramuh.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Needless to say, there is only one among our number to have faced them all.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: And though these words of gratitude were addressed to our order as a whole, I feel that they were meant for you above all others.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I, too, must offer my heartfelt thanks for all that you have done. In the course of your duties, you have never once failed to answer my call to arms.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: You are a true hero, Forename, and Eorzea is that much the safer for your presence.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Pray do not misunderstand me─I said “safer,” not “safe.” I know only too well that we can ill afford to lower our guard. The Ascians may be relied upon to sow chaos in this realm until such time as they are forced to stop.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Why, even without their encouragement, you may be assured that man would foment strife on his own. And that is to say nothing of the beast tribes. Unless we learn to live in harmony, the primals, too, will return to plague us again and again and again...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: And yet...despite all of this, your deeds serve to inspire the people─to give them hope for a better tomorrow. And there is no greater gift.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: That we have the courage to strive for what might otherwise seem an impossible peace, we owe in no small part to the dangers you have faced on our behalf, and the people you have won over to our cause in so doing. Our list of enemies has ever been long, but think of the allies with whom we are now blessed...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Of the beastmen who wish naught of conflict, and who now call you friend.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Of the sylphs of Little Solace, who wish naught of conflict.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Of Alisaie, who strives to unearth the terrible secrets of the Calamity.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Of the Ala Mhigans and the Domans who stand with us, determined to halt the dread march of the Empire.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: And then there is Cid and the fellowship of NOAH, racing to unlock the mysteries of ancient Allag that we might be spared the horror of another Ultima Weapon.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: And then there are the many unsung individuals who have gathered here in Revenant's Toll─honest men and women who seek to employ their skills for the good of all.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...Of course, when speaking of our greatest allies, we must not forget those closest to us, by which I mean our fellow Scions.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thanks to their many and varied talents, our order is uniquely equipped to combat the far-reaching corruption of the Ascians─and combat it we shall!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-???-)Your enthusiasm is truly heartwarming, Antecedent. Given our embarrassing wealth of allies, I trust it will not inconvenience you unduly if I absent myself for a time?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud! I take it the troubles in Ul'dah no longer require your attention?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There are yet some rumblings of discontent, but the air of simmering violence is largely dissipated. 'Tis to report such that I stand before you now.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That...and to speak with you concerning the new organization we discussed.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, I have a message for you from Ele─ Ahem. You recall the refugee girl? The one whose parents were missing? They were found unharmed. She wished me to pass on her thanks to you.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Why, Alphinaud! Am I to understand that you made the effort to remember the poor girl's name? I look forward to reading all about her in your report. I do hope you left nothing out!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Forename─you have been away from Revenant's Toll for some time now, I believe. Might I suggest that you put the affairs of the realm to one side for the moment and take this opportunity to reacquaint yourself with the town?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...Which reminds me─one of the Doman children recently inquired as to your whereabouts. Yozan was his name. I believe he has some small matter he wishes to share with you. Why not oblige him with a visit?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I realize that you must be quite tired from your travails, but I would most appreciate it if you could find a moment to speak to young Yozan. He has been through much in his own right, I am sure.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Look! It's MissMister Forename! She'sHe's back from herhis adventures!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: We heard you were off fighting “primals,” and that they're some of the strongest enemies you could ever face! I wish I could've seen you in battle...

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Anyway, we all want to be heroes, too─so we finally formed our very own Doman Adventurers' Guild to protect all the Domans!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Oh! Do you think you could train us today, MissMister Forename? Maybe you could show us how you fought the primals!

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: (-???-)What's all this commotion, then?

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Mister Boulder and Mister Coultenet! Did you know that MissMister Forename is back!?

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: So it would seem. Welcome home, Forename. My companion and I but recently became full members of the Scions, and I believe proper introductions have yet to be made.

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: I am known as Hoary Boulder, and this bookish fellow is Coultenet. Though we remain largely unproven as adventurers, we have taken it upon ourselves to instruct the Doman younglings in the arts of combat.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Ugh, I told you, Mister Boulder: we are not younglings anymore─we are adventurers!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: And we were just asking MissMister Forename if shehe could give us some special training. I think we're ready to hunt monsters alongside herhim, don't you?

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: Well, you've certainly been diligent with your drills...but I'm afraid the fiends of Mor Dhona are still ever so slightly too dangerous for you.

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: I have a counter-proposal: what if I were to cross swords with Forename? A demonstration of skill at arms, if you will.

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text: Hoary. If I didn't know you better─and I do─I'd say you were merely seeking to test yourself against a legend.

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: Ahahaha, well, mayhaps I am. But what matters the motive when the children stand to learn so much from the lesson?

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: What say you, Forename? Would you consent to spar with me?

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Hurrah! We're to have a tournament! Come on, everyone─we must prepare our gear for an outing!

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text: ...Do try not to disappoint them, hm?

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: Have faith, Coultenet! I shall summon every last onze of my strength to make of this a worthy contest.

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: The fields to the east of town should prove suitable for our purpose. I very much look forward to our bout.

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text: Since becoming a Scion, I have had much opportunity to hear news of your epic deeds. I must confess, then, that my excitement rivals that of the children's at the prospect of seeing you in action firsthand.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: MissMister Forename is here! Let the battle begin!

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: As we left the Rising Stones, Mister Thancred asked us where we were going. I told him we were off to watch you and Mister Boulder fight, and he looked very surprised. I hope we haven't made him cross...

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: Is sparring...dangerous? I don't think I want to see anyone else being hurt...

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: We had a Master of Lessons back in Doma, and the way he taught us was very different from Mister Boulder. I'm not sure which way is better, but I think I like them both!

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: 'Twas good of you to agree to this, Forename. I trust you are ready to begin?

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: Very well. Let us not keep the younglings waiting any longer!

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text: Ahem. Hoary? Are you certain you wish to fight herhim alone? That is Forename you face.

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: What better way to test my mettle? Pray allow me to attempt the first round unaided.

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: After all, 'twas this hero's legend that led me to join the Scions to begin with. Without Forename to inspire my efforts, I would not be half the warrior I am today.

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text: Your point is well made. But remember: this is for the children's sake as well as your own. Should it appear the contest will end too swiftly, I shall add my spells to your bladework.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Hello! You haven't begun yet, have you?

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: Yda!? What─ Who are all these people!?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: When I heard about your sparring match, I told everyone I could find. Thought you could use a crowd to cheer you on!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Yes, and there are still more to come. When I mentioned Forename's name, the reaction was quite enthusiastic.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Why, my own popularity seems but a sickly shade in comparison! You'd best claim victory, Bringer of Light─your burgeoning reputation is at stake!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Well, our teacher won't be beaten so easily! He's a master swordsman!

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: You can win, Mister Boulder!

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: We shall soon see. On your guard!

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: You... <gasp> You have bested me... <huff> I yield!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: <gasp> ...

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: ...That was incredible! SheHe beat them both at the same time!

dialogue.name: SPECTATORMAN01456
dialogue.text: We knew you couldn't lose, Forename! None can defeat the guardian of Eorzea!

dialogue.name: SPECTATORWOMAN1456
dialogue.text: Now I see why they send you to deal with the primals! I've much work to do if I'm ever to attempt the same...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Impressive as always, Forename. 'Tis ever a pleasure to witness the spectacle of your martial prowess.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And judging by the smiles on these many faces, they, too, appreciate the hard-won strength that keeps the perils of the realm at bay.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: “Guardian of Eorzea”... Yes, that is a most fitting title.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Do you recall when first we met? 'Twas at the memorial service for the Battle of Carteneau...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: At the time, I was yet attempting to understand this land of Eorzea. I sought to grasp the reason why Grandfather willingly sacrificed himself to protect it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I shall speak plainly: my initial impressions were less than favorable. Dire problems abounded, and yet the effort I saw expended towards their solution was haphazard and half-hearted. I thought Eorzeans a foolish and childish people.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Considering the shambles their home was in, I would not have been surprised if some had chosen to swear allegiance to Gaius and the order he proposed to enforce. The legatus's single-minded military invasion precluded any such switching of loyalties, of course.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Were it not for a desire to continue Grandfather's legacy, I would have abandoned the realm to its fate long ago. The threats were too many, the nations too self-involved and unstable.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Twas you who convinced me the salvation of Eorzea was possible.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Twas you who taught me─through countless acts of bravery─that what my grandsire sought to preserve was not the land, nor its history, nor any single nation...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It was the people. These wonderful, oft infuriating, stubborn people that suffer blow after terrible blow only to drag themselves back to their feet to face another day.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though he never put such feelings into words, I believe Grandfather's admiration for this inextinguishable courage grew into a fervent wish─a wish to aid Eorzea and its inhabitants in charting a course for the future.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A wish that has now become my own.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I, too, will endeavor to take up the mantle of guardian of Eorzea, and champion these people who toil towards a better world.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Our cause, however, is not a simple one: the troubles that plague us are of a scale that cannot be solved by the Scions of the Seventh Dawn alone.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: No, what is needed to tackle the root of the primal threat─and effectively counter the schemes of the Ascians─is a new, expanded organization that operates beyond the limitations of nations and borders.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If you would aid me in building such an organization, then pray let us continue this discussion back within the walls of the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming, Forename. The world shifts and alters, and we, my friend, must ever be one step ahead of the chaos.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: What I propose is the formation of a new organization─a group that shall pave the way for a truly united Eorzea...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: With the primal threat presently subdued, now is the perfect time to focus on new endeavors.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud has long been laying the groundwork for this organization of his, and he looks to you to help turn his proposal into reality. Pray lend him what aid you can.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Your bout with Hoary Boulder was more stirring than a hundred lines of my most passionate poetry. Mayhaps I should arrange a sparring match of my own...

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: I can't wait for Alphinaud to start his new company. I love making new friends!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: I wish Yda were not so eager to look to the future when we have so many problems in the here and now...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I fear Yda's boundless optimism is beginning to affect my better judgment. And your tendency to triumph against the most terrible of foes is certainly not helping matters.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: No, this won't do at all! And then I'll have to─ Oh, hello, Forename! If you don't mind, I'm terribly busy at the moment!

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: 'Tis not enough that I am here for my daughter─I must do what little I can to help you all succeed in your monumental tasks.

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: Forename! I must thank you again for agreeing to our bout.

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: ...And I must thank the gods 'twas not a duel to the death! I will, however, cherish the lesson of each scrape and bruise as I work to better my swordplay.

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text: I thought the idea foolish at first, but it seems that sparring match well served its purpose. Why, I can hardly wait to return to my studies and seek to improve upon my technique!

dialogue.name: HOUZAN
dialogue.text: My people's spirits were thoroughly crushed by the loss of our homeland, but thanks to your courage and generosity I see their inner flames once more flicker back to life. I, too, have felt my strength of will make a gradual return.

dialogue.name: DOUWARE
dialogue.text: Our Doman farming methods have been adopted here on the frontier. 'Tis too early yet to know if they will prove to be effective...

dialogue.name: HIGIRI
dialogue.text: This place has become as a hive, and its bees flit about in constant motion. Perhaps a soothing pot of tea will coax one or two to alight and take a moment's rest.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Mister Boulder fought well, but he was no match for you, MissMister Forename!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Just you wait! One day I'll be good enough to knock you from the top of your mountain!

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: Mister Boulder is sore and beaten, but he said he'd return straight to his training. Heh heh, I don't think he likes to lose!

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: We need to decide who in our Adventurers' Guild will do what. I'm fairly sure Yozan will have to be the swordfighter─he always has to be in the thick of the action.

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: I like the way Mister Coultenet fought─no swords or fists. I wonder, if I studied hard, would I be able to cast spells like that too?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Win the sparring match!

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text:
Day and night I've honed my skills.
Now comes the time to test them!

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text:
Ugh... Such power!
The tales barely do you justice!

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: Mister Boulder won't lose, will he?

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: It's not over yet! It can't be!

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text: Aye, the children have the right of it.

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text:
'Tis time I joined the fray.
On your feet, Hoary!

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: Oh no! He looks hurt...

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text:
MissMister Forename is so strong...
But you can't give up, Mister Boulder!

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text:
Can't...disappoint...the younglings...
Raaargh!

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text:
Never have I faced such strength!
...But the lesson must continue!

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text:
'Tis your example I follow!
Surrender not to the implacable foe!

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text:
I must admit defeat.
'Twas an honor and a privilege...

obj.n: What Little Gods Are Made Of
